d1e3.d: The remote control has components that allow you to program and operate the light bulbs on your lighting network.

d1e10.d: Remote lighting allows you to operate network-based home lighting through a remote control.

d1e17.d: The network lighting components have specific electronic and technical specifications.

d1e24.d: Specifications describing the electronics and technology inside the remote control.

d1e31.d: Network lighting operates at a low level of networking power but can successfully connect at long distances because they can send information from light bulb to light bulb.

d1e39.t: Considerations for Planning Your Lighting Network
d1e39.d: Before installing your network lighting, you should plan how you want your lighting network to behave.

d1e46.t: Maximum Number of Network Light Bulbs
d1e46.d: Testing shows you should network no more than 250 light bulbs to maintain reliable performance.

d1e53.d: Specifications describing the electronics and technology inside the LED light bulb.

d1e60.d: You can network LED light bulbs together to operate wirelessly from a remote control.

d1e67.t: Programming Light Bulbs to Lighting Groups
d1e67.d: You can program one or more light bulbs to a lighting group to operate that group with your remote control.

d1e74.t: Turning On/Off or Dimming a Lights
d1e74.d: You can turn on, turn off, or dim a lighting group by pressing the group number button and then pressing the power button or the dimmer control.
